column2: WI DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. In Wisconsin, if you have an instruction permit or probationary license using a cell phone while driving is against the law in Wisconsin except:
2. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column10: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.

column2: 3. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
4. This road sign means:
5. If a vehicle suddenly cuts in front of you creating a hazard, which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column6: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Sound your horn and step on the brake firmly.

column2: 6. An orange-colored sign means:
7. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 8. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
9. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.

column2: 10. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
11. Drivers should change lanes:
12. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column6: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.

column2: 13. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 14. The road is the most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.
column6: when it's been raining for 30 minutes or more.

column2: 15. What do warning signs mean?
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 16. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column6: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 17. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column6: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column8: Drivers are not required to stop.
column10: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.

column2: 18. When driving in rainy weather, you should:
19. When a pedestrian carrying a white cane is at the corner ready to cross the street in front of you, before making your right turn, you should:
column4: yield the right-of-way and wait until the pedestrian crosses the street.
column6: use your horn to help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: tell the pedestrian where to cross the street.
column10: turn off the ignition until the person crosses the street.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
21. This road sign means:
22. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 23. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
24. If you are involved in a serious motor vehicle crash:
column4: report the crash to the police.

column2: 25. As the percentage of alcohol in your blood (BAC) increases, you become:
26. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 27. Signs with orange backgrounds mean:
28. When you plan to turn, you should signal at least ______ before you turn.
29. This road sign means:
column6: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 30. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
column10: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way

column2: 31. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column6: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column8: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column10: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column2: 32. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column6: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column8: slow down and pass the bus with caution.

column2: 33. This sign means:
column6: The traffic signal is not operational

column2: 34. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
35. This sign indicates that the road ahead:
36. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: slow down and adjust their driving manner.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 38. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 39. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: quickly change speed or lane position.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.

column2: 40. To keep your vehicle from rolling into traffic when parked on a hill, if you are facing uphill you should:
column4: turn the front wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column6: set the parking brake and keep the front wheels straight.
column8: turn the back wheels towards the curb or edge of the road.
column10: turn the front wheels away from the curb or edge of the road.

column2: 41. At a crosswalk:
column6: construction workers must yield to drivers.

column2: 42. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
43. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.
column6: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column10: keep more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 44. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles are not allowed in this area

column2: 45. This road sign means:
46. The octagonal shape is used:
column6: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column8: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 47. This sign means:
column4: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane
column6: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must turn to the right
column8: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column10: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less

column2: 48. When the road is slippery you should:
49. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 50. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column10: prepare to leave the lane safely.
